livrodigital.title: SME Digital: Livro
livrodigital.subtitle: An accessible and interactive digital solution transforming printed textbooks to reduce learning obstacles in education

projectDescription.introduction: The SME Digital: Book project aimed to transform a collection of printed textbooks into an accessible and interactive digital solution. As the Design Lead, my role was to lead this transformation, overcoming challenges related to performance, usability, and accessibility.
projectDescription.problemStatement: The main challenge was adapting content originally designed for print into a digital format, optimizing it for mobile reading. The first version of the app faced significant performance issues, with layouts that didn’t work well on smaller screens and a suboptimal reading experience.

solution.text: The solution involved a complete overhaul of the interface and the way content was rendered in the app.
bullets: Redesigning the layout for an optimized and responsive reading experience.
Creating a consistent design system, allowing component scalability for future iterations.
Implementing advanced accessibility features such as font adjustments, high contrast, and colorblind-friendly options.
Developing a hybrid functionality that allowed seamless navigation between the printed and digital versions of the books.

impact.text: The impact was significant, reflected both in user experience and platform usage metrics.
bullets: Over 200 books transformed into interactive digital versions.
File size reduced from 400 MB to 40 MB (90% reduction), significantly improving download times and app performance.
Positive user feedback regarding usability and the inclusion of accessible features.

learningAndRefinement.text: Throughout the project, I honed my frontend development skills, including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React. I also deepened my knowledge in designing user-centered, accessible digital products.
refinements: If I could revisit the project, I would include advanced annotation features and further simplify the interface, making navigation even more intuitive.
I would explore adding real-time collaborative features to increase engagement between teachers and students.

card-01.title: Accessibility
card-01.text: To enhance the reading experience, we implemented features like adjustable fonts, high contrast and color-blind friendly marker colors. We also chose fonts optimized for long screen reads, such as Literata and OpenDyslexic.

card-02.title: hybrid interface
card-02.text: We developed a functionality that not only allows students to switch between the digital and printed books but also shows which page of the physical book they're on while navigating the digital version.

card-03.title: Optimized Performance
card-03.text: Reduced the file size of books from 400 MB to 40 MB on average (a 90% reduction), improving download times and app fluidity.

card-04.title: Production Process Automation
card-04.text: Implemented scripts and XML content extraction, reducing development time.
